title: Remove Nodes From Linked List
statement: Remove nodes from a linked list that have a node with a greater value to their right.

example.explanation: Nodes 5, 2, and 3 are removed because a greater value exists to their right.

title: Smallest Subsequence of Distinct Characters
statement: Return the lexicographically smallest subsequence that contains all distinct characters exactly once.

example.explanation: Removing extra characters while preserving order gives the smallest subsequence.

title: Next Greater Node In Linked List
statement: For each node in a linked list, find the value of the next node that has a greater value.

example.explanation: The next greater node for 2 is 5, for 1 is 5, and none exists for 5.

title: Final Prices With a Special Discount in a Shop
statement: Apply a discount to each item equal to the next item with a smaller or equal price to its right.

example.explanation: Each price is reduced by the next smaller or equal price to its right.

title: Remove All Adjacent Duplicates in String II
statement: Repeatedly remove groups of k adjacent duplicate characters from a string.

example.explanation: All groups of 3 adjacent duplicates are removed iteratively.

title: Min Stack
statement: Design a stack that supports push, pop, top, and retrieving the minimum element in constant time.

example.input: push(-2), push(0), push(-3), getMin(), pop(), top(), getMin()
example.explanation: The stack tracks the minimum element at each operation.

title: Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters
statement: Find the length of the longest substring that contains at most k distinct characters.

example.explanation: The substring "ece" has at most 2 distinct characters and length 3.

title: Fruit Into Baskets
statement: Return the length of the longest subarray that contains at most two distinct values.

example.explanation: Only two fruit types are present in the entire array.

title: Reverse Substrings Between Each Pair of Parentheses
statement: Reverse substrings inside each pair of matching parentheses, starting from the innermost.

example.explanation: Inner substrings are reversed first, then outer ones.

title: Asteroid Collision
statement: Simulate collisions between asteroids moving along a line and return the final state.

example.explanation: The asteroid -5 collides with 10 and is destroyed.

title: Lexicographically Minimum String After Removing Stars
statement: Remove characters based on star operations to produce the lexicographically smallest possible string.

example.explanation: The star removes the smallest possible character to its left.

title: Using a Robot to Print the Lexicographically Smallest String
statement: Simulate a robot using a stack to generate the lexicographically smallest string possible.

example.explanation: The robot delays printing to achieve lexicographical order.

title: Minimum Window Substring
statement: Given two strings s and t, return the minimum window substring of s such that every character in t (including duplicates) is included in the window.

example.explanation: The substring "BANC" contains all characters of t with minimum length.

title: Find All Anagrams in a String
statement: Given two strings s and p, return all the start indices of p's anagrams in s.

example.explanation: Substrings starting at indices 0 and 6 are anagrams of "abc".

title: Sort Characters By Frequency
statement: Sort the characters in a string by decreasing frequency.

example.explanation: Characters are ordered by frequency of occurrence.

title: Decode String
statement: Decode an encoded string with nested repetition patterns.

example.explanation: The substring inside brackets is repeated based on the number.

title: Remove All Adjacent Duplicates In String
statement: Remove all adjacent duplicate characters from a string repeatedly.

example.explanation: Adjacent duplicates are removed until no more exist.

title: Valid Anagram
statement: Determine if two strings are anagrams of each other.

example.explanation: Both strings contain the same characters with the same frequencies.

title: Backspace String Compare
statement: Compare two strings after processing backspace characters.

example.explanation: Both strings become "ac" after processing backspaces.

title: First Unique Character in a String
statement: Find the index of the first non-repeating character in a string.

example.explanation: The character 'l' is the first character that does not repeat.

title: Binary Tree Maximum Path Sum
statement: Return the maximum sum of any path in a binary tree.

example.explanation: The path 15 → 20 → 7 gives the maximum sum.

title: All Nodes Distance K in Binary Tree
statement: Find all nodes that are distance K from a given target node.

example.explanation: These nodes are exactly 2 edges away from the target.

title: Binary Tree Right Side View
statement: Return the values of the nodes visible from the right side.

example.explanation: The rightmost node at each level is visible.

title: Diameter of Binary Tree
statement: Return the length of the longest path between any two nodes.

example.explanation: The path 4 → 2 → 1 → 3 has length 3.

title: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree
statement: Find the lowest common ancestor of two nodes in a binary tree.

example.explanation: Node 3 is the lowest node that has both 5 and 1 as descendants.

title: Validate Binary Search Tree
statement: Determine if a binary tree is a valid binary search tree.

example.explanation: The tree satisfies BST ordering constraints.

title: Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree
statement: Convert a sorted array into a height-balanced BST.

example.explanation: Middle elements are chosen to keep the tree balanced.

title: Sum of Left Leaves
statement: Return the sum of all left leaf nodes.

example.explanation: The left leaves are 9 and 15.
